May 25 2006	Very Friendly Staff	We stayed in this hotel for four nights in early May for a wine-country vacation. We knew ahead of time that the parking was going to be $45 per day, so we were prepared for the cost involved. We knew that San Francisco is made up of several one-way streets, so it was not hard to navigate our way around to the vehicle entrance. (hint: if you pull up to the front of the hotel on 4th, the bellman will give you a piece of paper with instructions on what streets to take and what direction to turn to take you around to the valet entrance). The bathroom was typical, but the Kohler shower head was amazing! I've never been so impressed with a hotel shower in my life! My only complaint was that housekeeping came early every day. We are not early risers (even on vacation) and housekeeping was knocking on our door at about 9am each day. I had to ask them to please come back later EVERY day. The best experience of all, however, was the staff in the lobby and at the front desk. There was a delightful gentleman, average height with a bald head that stood in the lobby, and each morning as we were leaving he would greet us, and each evening when we returned he asked us how our day was...where did we eat for lunch, etc. After the second day he recognized us and made a point to say hello. Also fabulous was the gentleman behind the front desk with an exceptional taste in ties. He had a great colorful tie on each day, and when we checked in he was fantastic.

May 1 2006	Clean and quiet	We stayed 2 days after arrival from an overseas flight and asked for a quiet room to recover from jet lag. The receptionist gave us a a nice corner room with no neighbours and we could recover properly. The room was very clean and comfortable. The view was not breathtaing but O.K.If you look for a great view go to the bar on top of the hotel, grab yourself a beer and enjoy sunset.

Apr 30 2006 	Great Hotel	All staff was friendly and accomodating. Great corner room on the 24th floor. Roomy and very clean. Within walking distance of many locations and public transportation. This was my 2nd visit to SF and I enjoyed this hotel much better than the Fairmont.

Apr 28 2006 	Overall a good hotel	Marriott San Francisco (on Market Street) April 2006This hotel is quite nice. It's a convention hotel so you get what comes with that: a huge impersonal lobby, hordes of people going/coming from the convention, and so on. Location is in the middle of the shops on Market Place, right near a BART station, a nice walk down to the Embarcadero. Parking at hotel is very expensive but there are nearby municipal lots for about $22 per 24-hours (no in/out privileges). If you can, park at one of the east-bay BART stations ($5 per 24 hour period but reservations for long-term parking need to be made in advance; instructions at the BART website) and ride BART in. Pretty much anything you could want is near-by: drug store, office depot, radio shack, all the shops you'd find in a mall, cafes, restaurants (from cheap to expensive), a copy place just a block or two away on Market Street with fairly cheap internet access (10 cents/minute with $1.50 minimum charge - hotel internet is $13 per 24 hour period (noon to noon, I believe), or, at the business center (limited hours), $4 for 15 minutes). We couldn't find an internet cafe nearby.The reception staff were quite competent; I checked in before the "rush" so there wasn't much of a wait. I requested a later check-out which was granted so check-out didn't involve a wait, either. I requested that no newspapers be delivered but USA Today was delivered anyhow. When I checked out, I left my luggage at the luggage check. Luggage drop-off was quite quick, but luggage pick-up involved a long wait. To add insult to injury, there were a number of us in line, but when the employee came back from retrieving someone else's items, he went to a businessman who had just arrived and who was standing on the other side of the podium, well outside the line, and helped him before helping those of us who were standing in line. Needless to say, I didn't give him the tip I had prepared.The rooms were acceptable. Clean, recently renovated, but impersonal. The hotel has gone to duvets which I wholly approve of, and beds have a nice selection of pillows (4) of varying firmness. No mini-bar in the room (I usually store my drinks in the refrigerator), so I requested a refrigerator be delivered, which was quite loud and ugly. The bed was fairly comfortable - a bit soft for my liking - I didn't tear the bed apart but the mattress was either a pillow top mattress or had a feather bed under the sheet. Bathroom floors were marble tile which was quite a nice touch and the vanity was wooden with built-in shelves for the towels. The office chair at the desk was a little ratty. There was no fan in the bathroom although ventilation seemed fairly strong (but no way to turn it off if you wanted to steam up the bathroom to remove wrinkles from clothes).I asked for a room in the highest tower as I had read that rooms closest to the street could be noisy. Street noise was not a problem if the windows were closed. I also asked for a room well away from elevators, ice machines, traffic, etc. and did not have any problems with hallway noise. I was on the 24th floor on the St. Patrick's Cathedral side ("city" view) which had as good a view as any of the higher floors as surrounding buildings were high enough to block the view from them as well as from the 24th floor.The room overall was quite clean although it was clear under the bed had not been vacuumed in quite some time, which is really surprising seeing as it shouldn't take much time at all to run a vacuum under the bed (assuming the Marriott has purchased vacuums which fit under the bed - if they haven't, that is pretty stupid). Marriott's policy is to NOT change bedsheets for guests staying multiple nights unless a card is placed on the bed - I highly approve of this policy as it's much better for the environment. In addition to the Gideon Bible, the Marriott is providing the Book of Mormon. In my opinion, all religious material should be removed from the rooms and only delivered upon guest request.The room had a hair dryer which almost burst into flames the first time I tried using it. It kept dying and I thought it was a problem with the outlet, but then a bit of smoke started coming out of the exhaust vent and I quickly unplugged it. It was replaced in about 15 minutes by housekeeping by the same model which worked fine. Marriott probably buys extremely cheap hair dryers (who can blame them as people are probably careless with them) which eventually short out as mine did.The best part of the hotel was the fitness center. There was no additional charge for using the equipment, although use of the shower room/locker involved a $5 additional charge. There was quite a range of machines to use and an adequate number. The pool was small - not good for lap swimming, although the hot tub was huge. I don't trust the cleanliness of hotel pools/hot tubs (due to all the kids) so did not use them. In the reception area of the fitness center, they had ice water with lime or lemon, plus a variety of fruits (apples, bananas, oranges) and plenty of towels. Other hotels I have stayed at have charged to used fitness centers that are this nice. The tread mills and recumbent bikes are hooked up to the hotel's cable, although you do need to bring your own headphones.The concierge line was quite long every time I passed by; the one night when we wanted information and were in line, the bellboy came over and offered to help. We wanted information about the Mission District: best burrito place and help finding an ice cream place I had been to before but didn't recall the name of. He was quite helpful: he knew the ice cream place and provided directions but couldn't recall the name (we found it and it's called Bombay - I strongly recommend it although it closes relatively early), and sent us to Pancho Villa for burritos which had fantastic and cheap burritos. I think we got better information from him than we would have from the concierge, who was probably used to sending guests to far pricier restaurants. The bellboy, in contrast, lived in the Mission District.I had previously stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square and thought it was nice, but the Marriott's fitness center and somewhat better location make it the better hotel, in my opinion. The Hyatt's top-floor bar is nice (but pricey); the Marriott is supposed to have a nice view from their top-floor bar, but I never made it up there.

Apr 18 2006	Outstanding	Location is perfect if you're in town for all the traditional sights: Everything from 24-hour diners to world-class shopping is within easy walking distance, and transport to more distant attractions is a snap. Service personnel were exceptionally helpful and courteous (but never instrusive); rooms were spotless and well-insulated from external noise, and on-site facilities were first class. Unlike so many other establishments of its caliber (and there are quite a few in SFO), a four-star property that actually delivers on every promise. Highly recommended.

Apr 7 2006 	Be Careful When Booking this Hotel!	I stayed at the Marriott SF on April 5, and the first minute I arrived, the problems started. First the entrance to the hotel is NOT the hotel address. It's about 4 blocks via one way streets. I missed a turn and spent 10 minutes getting back to the entrance. The parking was an astronomic $45 a day! I am a Marriott rewards member, so I was confident I would get a nice room on a high floor. When I walked in to my 35th floor room, I found that I had a great view of the air conditioner units. I immediately called the front desk, and was politely told I could have a 4th floor room instead. When I complained to the manager, she gave me a 14th floor room, overlooking piles of garbage on the roof of the hotel's other wing. It was terrible! The room itself was OK, especially the bathroom, but the high speed internet costs another $13 a day. This hotel is dedicated to taking your money as efficently as possible. In conclusion, I would not rate this hotel as a 4 star, and I give the management a resounding "F" as in extremely poor. I will not stay at this Marriott again.

Mar 22 2006	Excellent 	I stayed in Marriott on Fourth Street during the weekend of the NIKE Womens Marathon. The room was magnificant and VERY clean! The view of San Francisco from the hotel room was incredible. The upstairs bar/lounge/restaurant was a nice with a relaxing atmosphere. The staff was friendly and willing to assist with any questions or concerns. The breakfast buffet was a little pricey but well worth the cost. It is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco with Trolley and Cable Car service easliy accessible. Very nice hotel!! Definately a place to stay!!

Mar 17 2006 	Great Hotel	I just got back from staying at this hotel. Overall it was a very pleasurable experience. The room was very comfortable and user friendly for a business traveler. They did not charge for using the gym, which many hotels do. Finally, the breakfast in thier Terrace restaurant was surprisingly good. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are staying near the convention center or Union Square.

Mar 1 2006 	Great Location	The location of the hotel was excellent. Walking distance to Union Square, Sears Restaurant on Powell (great breakfast), San Francisco Mall, Crate&Barrel, H&M, Anthropologies, William Sonoma, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Metronome, Moscone Ctr. etc.... It was also very close to the cable car and BART. The rooms were very clean and the size just enough room for two. I was disappointed that they did not have a coffee machine to make a cup when I get up or even making hot water for tea in the evening or a small mini bar. They do have a coffee kiosk downstairs in the lobby but there was a long line with only one person working there. I preferred to go to Coffee Bean for coffee around the corner on Market Street for its mocha ice blended coffee. We rented a car for couple of days and found the overnight parking was extremely high of $45.00 and you had to have it valet parked so by the time you add the tax and tip try dishing out $50.00 (that's more than the rented car per day) I found a public parking on 5th and Mission across kiddie corner from the hotel which was $22.00 for 24 hours.  I noticed on the floor where we stayed the room service tray was not picked up right away and were sitting out all day.  The water pipe made loud noises when the neighboring guest were using the bathroom. Going to and from our rooms were great with the low, mid and high rise elevators. We didn't have to wait for the elevators at all and stopped on every floor.I love staying at the Marriott Hotels and I guess I am spoiled staying at the Marriott Resort Hotels in San Diego and Monterey Bay which were excellent hotels with all the ammenities.

Feb 22 2006 	First Class!	Attended a real estate convention so elected to stay on-site.A first class hotel in every regard. Expensive, yes but you get what you pay for. Had stayed at Hotel Rex the prior weekend, rated #6 when I last looked), and that was excellent too but in a different way. See my review. Horses for courses so to speak. If I was visiting San Francisco again and wanted a full-service top end hotel would definetly consider this Marriott.

Feb 19 2006	Lovely hotel	We stayed in the San Francisco Marriott for a long weekend in December 2005. The hotel was well located, only minutes walk from most of the attractions, and in very easy reach of the convenient public transport system.The staff at the hotel were always helpful and friendly, and knowledgeable about the local area. The staff offered help without having to be asked, for example, providing umbrellas on wet days.Food in the hotel was good and varied, between upmarket restaurants, through the sports bar, to the coffee facilities.I would definitely stay in the hotel again if I was in the area.

Feb 16 2006	Central Location Good Standard	We stayed at the Marriott for 4 nights at the end of January. The hotel is very well located within walking distance to the cable car turnaround and good shopping like the Virgin Megastore. The rooms were a very good size and very clean. The beds were fantastic and just what you needed after walking around all day. The only problem we had was the church bells ringing every morning waking us up but we were jet lagged anyway. We ate at the lobby restaurant and it was very nice with a piano player. This hotel is a very big convention hotel and is not for those looking for an intimate get away in a boutique hotel. Another plus for us was that we were renting a hertz car and they had a station in the lobby. The parking was expensive but then who in their right mind would want to drive around San Francisco when the public transport is so good. All in all we were very happy with our stay and had a great time.

Jan 23 2006	Not Bad Great Location	Nice hotel in a great location -- downtown and near many things to see and do. My husband and I stayed for one night and were disappointed that the View Bar was closed for renovations. The limited contact with the staff was good. The rooms were small - but typical by San Francisco standards. While the bed was quite comfortable and the room was clean, the room seemed a bit in need of an update (particularly compared to the Park Hyatt where we stayed several months earlier for close the same price.) Valet parking is a whopping $45 (but you're paying for convenience.) While I wouldn't pay the rack rate for this hotel, not a bad place to stay in the heart of San Francisco.

Jan 15 2006	Loved the Marriot	We stayed in Mariott for 5 days with two small children and it was excellent! Good, clean room with a beautiful view and good service. Great breakfast-buffet with friendly people. We loved to have a drink in the view-lounge at the 39th floor.

Jan 12 2006	Great Location	Was only in San Francisco for 2 nights so did not spend much time in the hotel - and when in such a hurry to see as much as possible it's great to stay in such an ideal location. It's very close to transport links, and the city centre.As a further note, when I went on to Las Vegas after staying here I realised I had left my mobile phone charger in the hotel room. One phone call and they had it sent on to my Vegas Hotel right away.

Jan 9 2006	Nickel and Dime Me	This hotel has a gorgeous lobby and nice rooms. However, one gets the feeling they are trying to squeeze nickels and dimes out of their guests. There is no coffee pot in the room, so the only alternative for the early morning cup is to go downstairs to their expensive Starbucks coffee kiosk (and to add insult to injury, I happen to dislike Starbucks). If you want a cup before 6:30 a.m., you're just plain out of luck--other than room service--as the kiosk is not open yet. This is extremely inconvient, and although it may sound small, it really diminished the experience for us. There is no honor bar. There are no robes. All very odd for a 4-star hotel. It's those extra little touches that make the difference, and this hotel apparently isn't interested in that. In my view, the devil is in the details. I wouldn't go back.

Jan 4 2006	It's the location!	We stayed here as part of a special christmas present for my three teenaged daughters. Here are some of the pluses. If you check the Marriott website they have specials which include parking in the hotel room costs (a $40 a day savings!). The room was nice, only a partial view but the beds were lovely and the bathroom was clean. The staff was friendly and very helpful. We live in the bay area and I wanted to stay close to the curran theatre and A.C.T. (both a easy walk). The girls loved being near union square (sephora, h&m, DSW, urban outfitters, macy's, betsey johnson - you get the idea). I'd recommend the hotel to anyone coming to the city for theatre or shopping, you are close to the meteron and to muni/cable cars/bart. In the past we've stayed at hotels in union square (st francis, etc.) but the marriott room was a great deal for the money and still close to everything. I'd recommend eating at one of the hundreds of great restaurants in the city and just having coffee or drinks at the hotel (the view bar is lovely). We will probably stay here on our next after-christmas fiesta!

Dec 23 2005	Terrific Hotel	Stayed for a night to do some shopping in San Francisco. The hotel was not crowded during Christmas week and we were able to check-in at 10a.m. The Front Office Manager was at the front desk and when we asked for a non-connecting room, he personally picked out a good one for us. Room 2640 was a corner room with a great view of Yerba Buena Gardens and Moscone Center. It was an oversized, nicely decorated room and had an extremely comfortable bed. The location was terriic, just 1/2 block from 4th and Market Streets (Nordstrom, Bloomingdales next year)and two blocks from Union Square and the major shopping area (Macy's, Saks, Beiman Marcus, etc). I highly recommend this hotel. If you do have a car, park in the 5th and Mission Garage across the street for $22 a day vs. $49 at the hotel.

Dec 9 2005 	Excellent Location Otherwise just OK	I stayed in this hotel on several occasions (from seminars to just a weekend in SF for fun) - the location of the hotel is great, just couldn't be better. You're walking distance to Union Square, a lot of downtown stores and restaurants, BART (which incidently takes you straight to SFO), Metrion, etc.; As far as food, we found it to be average, a bit overpriced (for a plain meal of steak & mashed potatoes or basic breakfast items), there're much better dining establishments in SF, so dinner at the Marriott is not worth your time; The rooms were a bit old, but overall quite large and comfortable, everything was in working order and functional; the showers were a bit small, but clean and in working order. If you'r in town for a few days I would certainly recommend this hotel (much better then other Marriott properties in the city), it could get a bit pricey, but you're getting quality for your $$..if you want true luxury, opt for the brand new St Regis, Fairmont, PanPacific, etc.

Nov 14 2005	Best hotel in town !!	My partner and I spent a week in San Fran at the Marriott, I have stayed in the city many times before at the Hilton, Crowne Plaza, The Mosser to name a few, but this really is the best hotel experience in town and centrally located, just a stone's throw from Union Square. Extremely courteous staff from the moment you check-in, very welcoming after a long and eventful flight from the UK (with emergency landing in Iceland!). We were upgraded to a suite with excellent city view and very well appointed accommodation for such a HUGE hotel. Very comfortable beds, sofas, spotless bathroom and very attentive housekeeping staff. Top floor bar has awesome city views and worth the trip in the elevator although the drink prices are steep. Shops shops and more shops, if you want a well-located venue for a city stay and indulge in retail therapy, this is the hotel for you. Also convenient for Market Street, the trolley to Fisherman's Wharf or towards Embarcadero, the nightlife of SoMa and nowhere that far by taxi - and no fewer than 4 Starbucks in short walking distance, including one in the lobby! There is a huge multistory carpark just across the road for those with rental vehicles and excellent dining spots all around - we liked the 24hr Mason Cafe on Mason St, 5 mins walk from the hotel and also Cheesecake Factory atop Macy's Union Square. We will definitely be returning to the Marriott for our next stay in San Francisco :-)

Nov 11 2005	Wonderful Hotel Great location	My 13-year old daughter and I spent several nights in San Francisco. I decided to spend a few nights in different hotels to get a different perspective of the city. We stayed in the San Francisco Marriott on a Saturday night as I found a great rate through AAA. From the moment we drove to the front entrance, we experienced great service. Check-in was pleasant and easy, as they allowed an early check-in of 1 p.m. We requested a high-level room, away from the church as an earlier reviewer advised. I also advise staying in a room away from the church, as the bells are amazingly loud! We had a very quiet room, but the elevators could be heard zipping up and down until about midnight and resumed at about 6 a.m. It wasn't terribly loud, but it could be heard. This hotel has an amazing gym- three different work-out rooms. We were quite pleased, and they were open 24-hours a day! The only thing I found strange, was the fact that the room did not have a coffee maker or a mini-bar. It did not pose a problem, as a vending machine was on every floor, and room service was reasonably priced and extremely quick. The hotel was located near Union Square and SoMa. It was an easy walk to Chinatown(my daughter's favorite part of the trip.) I recommend visiting the chinese bakery on Grant Street as they serve freah-out of the oven rolls, almond cookies and various other traditional pasteries. We waited in a long line that stretched out down the block, but it was worth it! We also ate at a Chinese restaurant near the bakery that was delicious- but the service was terrible. We were defintiely being ignored for some reason, but the fresh dumplings and spring rolls were quite good. This hotel is also right near the Powell Street BART.

Nov 10 2005	Honeymoon Bliss	My fiancee and I decided to get married at City Hall in our favorite city in the world - San Francisco. Our stay at the SF Marriott proved to be a perfect decision as the location and staff were all top-rate. The room was spacious, the bed complete with down comforter so comfortable we'd like to buy it and the view from our corner room was spectacular both day and night. In particular, the concierge - Jeff Clavin, went above and beyond to make sure our honeymoon was perfect. He arranged for a florist to deliver my bouquet, sent champagne and chocolates on his own accord as a surprise to our room on our wedding day and suggested restaurants we might enjoy for a special night out. Even the maid service respected our privacy and ensured we would be left alone unless needed. The entire staff heard about our upcoming wedding and we received congratulations from employees we hadn't even met. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Nov 8 2005 	I left my heart in San Francisco at the Marriott	I travel to San Francisco two or three times each year on business. The Marriott has become my favorite place to stay. The rooms and hallways have been recently renovated and they are magnificant for a "chain" hotel. The beds are comfortable, the rooms and bathrooms are clean, and the staff is first-rate. The pool and Fitness Center is fantastic.The lounge on the 39th Floor gives a beautiful view of the entire Bay area, and is unlike any other that I have visited since Windows on the World in New York. They have a wonderful wine selection, and a wait staff that remembers you (not sure if that is a good thing or not). It makes business travel a pleasure to have a place like this to visit.The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect as you are close to great restaurants (Lu Lu's is HIGHLY recommended...two blocks away), the Moscone Center and China Town.I highly recommend this hotel to ANYONE...it will meet all tastes and styles.

Oct 6 2005	Excellent Hotel	Stayed for three nights and couldn't have been happier. The staff were very kind and helpful from the moment we walked in. Rooms were larger than typical SF hotels, and slept soundly every night. Close to cable car, and muni busses, plus mega shopping. We were on the 29th floor with a nice view, and very pleased with our room.

Sep 26 2005	Excellent Service and Nice Rooms	Staff was SO helpful and nice. We had a pleasant experience. Rooms were nice and atmosphere was comfortable. The only thing I wasn't completely satisfied with was the bed. Since I am use to sleeping on a pretty firm mattress at home this bed was not comfortable because it wasn't firm.

Sep 19 2005 	A conventioneer's delight	Third stay her, each time for a few days, well managed, rooms larger and nicely furnished, better and bigger bathrooms than average, not intimate or boutique or romantic but a solid choice and convenient to everything including great shopping and restaurants,also excellent for BART transport, but try the Palace and the Argent in the same area if you want less of a "chain" choice, excellent concierge desk people, couples and singles could feel pushed out by the convention crowds but a good choice overall.

Aug 30 2005	Close to Union Square	We needed a getaway for one night, and got a deal on this through Priceline. We usually stay on Union Square, but this was only 2 blocks from there and the cable cars, and around the corner from Nordstroms. We wanted an early check in, and got it. Our room was very comfortable and clean, with not much of a view, but for one night, we weren't in it long enough to care. My husband avoided their parking fee of $46, and used the public lot at 5th and Mission for $22. There are no in and out priveleges, but once parked, we walked or rode the cable cars. We would probably stay here again.

Aug 30 2005	Easy In and Out	I stayed with my family for three nights and we loved the service. We arrived at the valet parking and were promptly met, our luggage was taken by a porter and we were escorted to the front desk and then to our room. A very nice start to our stay. The room was large and comfortable. I found the restaurant had a good menu selection and the waitstaff were attentive. I was on the east side of the building on the 9th floor which faced St. Mary's church. The first morning we all scrambled out of bed at 7:30 when the church bells began to ring. If you like to sleep late, do not have a view of the church. My ears are still ringing. I will warn you too about the valet parking. At peak times you may find yourself waiting 20 or 30 minutes to enter the hotel. But anytime you are traveling in SF, it is better to leave the car at home.

Aug 23 2005 	Great Hotel	Stayed here on business in the beginning of August 2005 and had a fabulous time. Friendly staff and a great location. Nice sized room and comfy bed. Would definitely recommend.

Aug 21 2005	Excellent Hotel	We spent a long time trying to find a decent hotel at the right price in SF. Eventually we settled on The Marriott and were not disappointed. The rooms were of ample size although I would suggest asking for high rise room. The indoor pool was a good size and nice and warm although we could find no changing rooms. On our last day we experienced a very enjoyable breakfast in the hotel. Yes it is a little expensive but is well worth it. If you do not require in house breakfast there are a couple of diners round the corner especially Loris and Dennys. Next to the hotel is a large multiscreen cinema and Sony centre which if you have teenagers with you they will thoroughly enjoy. Union Square is a 5 minute walk away and there are many shops in close proximity. The Tram buses to Fishermans Wharf are 2 minutes away and the cable cars are about 5 minutes. A word of caution was that there was no internet computer in the lobby therefore we had to hunt for an internet cafe which was 10 to 15 mins away. At night it can be easy to get lost and as you move away from the centre the area becomes a little dangerous to be around. Several people had mentioned this to us and during our stay in California we found more beggars on SF than any we visited. In summary the hotel was excellent with great views from the top floor at night. We spent 4 nights there and would certainly return to visit a number of places we ran out of time to see.

Aug 19 2005	Perfect Location	We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. The concierge staff was very friendly and helpful with questions about how to use transportation, etc. It seemed we were just a few steps away from any of the transportation options we needed. The room was comfortable, especially thanks to the down comforter and thermostat in the room. The View Lounge has really nice views of the city.

Aug 8 2005	Great Renovation	The SF Downtown Marriott was changed for the better. Newly remodeled, and quite comfortable. My husband and I were "walked" to this property after being told that the Renaissance Stanford Court was overbooked for the night. We were furious and had little confidence that the downtown Marriott would suit our needs as I did not remember it for being a tourist friendly property. We were proven wrong right away. The hotel is surprisingly quiet, roomy, and very comfortable. I would highly recommend for future stays.

Aug 2 2005	Excellent if it was not for the parking	Like the previous writer I found the parking charges outrageous. Luckily I had read about this on trip advisor before we left. We parked at the fifth and mission garage, it is on the opposite corner - enter on mission between fifth and fourth from the direction of fifth. It is only $22 per day with no in and out privileges. It is a city parking garage, you can find details of all of the city garages on the city website. We were passing through so we needed the car, but you really do not need a car in sf, the public transport is good and you can buy a muni pass for one, three or five days. As for the hotel, I thought it was great. Our room was a decent size, looked newly refurbished and was immaculately clean. It had everything we needed. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning which was good but a bit steep at $18 each. The main thing about the hotel is that is central, just off market and two minutes from union square, so that everything is really is easy to access. I am sure you could probably get good deals on other sites but we booked on marriott.com and paid $119 per night and thought we got value for money.The staff at the hotel were all friendly and helpful; in particular two of the concierge staff who helped us get set up with city tours. If you want to go to Alcatraz book before you leave. I tried to but there was a problem with the booking system. When I got there all the tickets were booked and we missed out. We could have stood in the standby queue but I heard that you can stand for up to seven hours.

Aug 1 2005	Big hotel but personal service	At first sight, this hotel seems like another big convention hotel (and there were several conventions there during our stay). But the service is very personal - all the staff are very friendly (special mention for Margaret at the concierge desk - great tour and restaurant recommendations, and how did she remember my (full) name when she deals with hundreds of people each day??!!).The buffet breakfast is great if you can eat that much in the morning (if you can, it will keep you going until dinner); if not, there is a Starbucks in the lobby. We had a room on the 28th floor with great views of Twin Peaks. The room itself was very large, very clean and comfortable. The hotel is located more or less at the junction of Stockton (leading to Union Square) and Market (a major (the main?) shopping street), so we had no complaints about location. Overall, 10 out of 10.
Jul 30 2005 	Don't park here	Don't park your car at the hotel because they charge $46.00/day to park your car. And you have no in or out ability. That's outrageous!!
